items.headline: Trump announces 100% tariffs on pharmaceuticals unless drug makers are building U.S. factories
items.summary_en: President Donald Trump announced a raft of new tariffs late Thursday, including a 100% levy on imported pharmaceuticals unless their manufacturers are actively building factories in the U.S.

items.headline: The Ryder Cup pours millions into promoting golf. But does the sport even need saving?

items.headline: Tesla is about to show a snapshot of its global sales. Is recent optimism deserved?
items.summary_en: Wall Street sales consensus has crept up, but some worry that a sales bump, if it comes, will be more about a rush to buy EVs ahead of expiring U.S. tax incentives.

items.headline: Trump floats using tariff money to help farmers hurt by trade wars
items.summary_en: President Donald Trump on Thursday promised to use revenue from his new taxes on imports to provide aid to American farmers, throwing his weight behind a proposal floated last week by his agriculture secretary.

items.headline: Costco’s same-store sales miss again, but it sees benefits from extra hours, Instacart deals
items.summary_en: Costco on Thursday reported fourth-quarter same-store sales that came up shy of Wall Street’s estimates, though the membership warehouse retailer’s per-share profit topped expectations.

items.headline: Should Apple buy Intel’s stock? These analysts suggest a better investment.
items.summary_en: Intel reportedly approached Apple about an investment, but absent “obvious benefits” to the smartphone giant, some analysts say the company would be better off just repurchasing more of its own stock.

items.headline: Opendoor’s stock soars after Jane Street’s ‘validation.’ What comes next?
items.summary_en: Shares of Opendoor Technologies Inc. are rallying on the disclosure that quantitative-trading firm Jane Street Group LLC has amassed a stake in the e-commerce platform for residential-real-estate transactions.
